case.name: NBAN v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs [2006] FCA 57 (8 February 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: applicant did not seek international protection abroad
inconsistencies not part of tribunal's decision
where tribunal may have made a jurisdictional error but there are independent grounds for concluding that the applicant is not entitled to a visa.

citances.sentence: I agree that VBAP (see also SZGXS v Minister for Immigration and Citizenship [2007] FCA 398 at [10] to [11], NBAN v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2006] FCA 57 at [63] ) provides authority to support the respondent's position.

In these circumstances I am able to find that the jurisdictional error that the Tribunal may have fallen into is irrelevant for the purposes of this decision and that the independent findings are free of such error and the matter should not be referred; VBAP v Minister for Immigration [2005] FCA 965 per North J followed by Edmonds J in SZEVE v Minister for Immigration [2006] FCA 390 and Moore J in NBAN v Minister for Immigration [2006] FCA 57.

legistitles.title: MIGRATION ACT 1958
MIGRATION ACT 1958 - SECT 424A Information and invitation given in writing by Tribunal
FEDERAL COURT RULES 1979
